title: Wtf is flex pick, why force night shift workers to play this garbage.
body:
What is the point of this queue? I don't have time to read through riot posts, forums or read patch notes. How the fuck did anyone fine this logical or any reasoning behind it? if i wanted a range of players from bronze to gold in my games i'd play normals. 

Also "Autofill" is ruining the game, i'd rather wait an extra 5min than having a support in my lane playing a champ they have no idea how to play and just afk in the back bush while you have to 1v2. Right away you've ruined 2 peoples game by forcing roles upon people.

replies.body:
Flex pick is made for premades, and solo players who're maybe feeling a bit adventurous. If you hate being matched with people clearly not in your elo range, don't play Flex Queue.

As with the case of Autofill. You need to be competent in at least 2-3 roles in Ranked anyway, might as well make Support one of them. Not mention, as Tele had brought up, without Autofill the queue times were just absolutely insane, and so it has to be there.

Also as Tele said, Autofill isn't the problem. Because it just shoves people into the role that has the significantly lesser amount of players queuing for in order to improve queue times, which right now it just so happens to be Support. If today everyone has made the decision to not queue for mid, then you'll see people start getting autofill'ed into mid lane. The problem is Support itself.

As for my opinion on Support role. I feel that as soon as Riot stop shoving Support into bot lane and intentionally keeping them there, there WILL be more Support players around for sure. They just need to stop forcing Support into a duo lane AND at bot lane.

As per OPs title if you typically play in the early morning you are forced into flex queue, I know from experience this can be quite frustrating, I've played against diamonds and plats in 5am flex queue games, often it feels like the outcome is determined before it starts. IMO it should be solo duo only - as this seems the more popular queue people are more likely to have correct MMRs and match making can have an easier time getting it right.

I agree on the autofil and support stuff though.

> [{quoted}](name=Tomphlosion,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=vkg8amMs,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-01-31T05:02:22.053+0000)
>
> As per OPs title if you typically play in the early morning you are forced into flex queue, I know from experience this can be quite frustrating, I've played against diamonds and plats in 5am flex queue games, often it feels like the outcome is determined before it starts. IMO it should be solo duo only - as this seems the more popular queue people are more likely to have correct MMRs and match making can have an easier time getting it right.

You got a point, I tend to agree.

Autofill isn't saving you an extra 5 minutes. If it was, Riot wouldn't have implemented it. In reality autofill is actually saving you 20 - 60 minutes in queue. 

I'm not sure if you played ranked before autofill, but queue times were insane, even in Bronze. [This guy](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/Jzgc3iUW-i-watched-the-entire-avengers-movie-in-the-time-i-waited-in-the-ranked-que) watched a 2 hour and 22 minute movie while in queue before autofill.

_Autofill isn't the problem, support is the problem._ Autofill is just a temporary solution Riot put in place while they rework support.

You can't "fix" support though.

The people that want to be the ones killing everyone aren't going to start playing support no matter how much "fun" or "engaging" riot make it. For the simple fact that you still wouldn't be the one killing everyone.

You can't fix the unfix-able so they need to make drastic changes to the entire game or everyone needs to stop complaining about queue times.

It looks to me like Riot's philosophy is that the vast majority of people aren't just looking to get the most kills, they want to have the most **impact**. And the issue is that support doesn't have much impact or recognition for that impact.

Impact can mean getting a triple kill as Riven. But it can also mean landing a game-winning 5 man Malphite ult where your ADC cleans up the kills.

Maybe Riot's philosophy is wrong, and most people really do just want kills. But personally I think that's the right approach.

Ummm... My Janna has HUGE impact.
There's a difference between impact and being able to win a 1v5.

Yeah, Janna, Thresh, Blitzcrank and Bard (to some extent) have really great impact already, and they happen to be some of the most popular supports. But they're still suffering from XP issues and downtime between fights like **Maraudaur** mentioned.

> [{quoted}](name=Tele,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=vkg8amMs,comment-id=00010000000000000001,timestamp=2017-01-31T02:16:00.292+0000)
>
> Yeah, Janna, Thresh, Blitzcrank and Bard (to some extent) have really great impact already, and they happen to be some of the most popular supports. But they're still suffering from XP issues and downtime between fights like **Maraudaur** mentioned.

That's part and parcel of being a support! Riot can change things for all they like, but the meta will adapt with it. If they make supports gain more xp by introducing new items, other lanes will use it also. If they make the support "position" in champion select gain more xp, smart teams will do a role swap so that their carries gain it. You can't fix "support". Support is a role determined by the meta, not set in stone. If they change the game on summoner's rift to have 3 players, for example, you wouldn't have a support.

This might provide some more insight into very early thinking about supports

http://askghostcrawler.tumblr.com/post/155454221703/so-is-there-a-game-plan-for-the-support-problem

> **“So is there a game plan for the support problem yet? Are we lookin at item level changes? systemic changes? It would be great for more varied and interesting support choices champion-wise, but that is definitely more of a long-term thing rather than short, obviously.”
**

> This is a big potential project with a lot of risk if we screw it up, so I don’t want to speculate too much yet. At a high level, there are three broad areas we are exploring:
> 1) More agency for Support players. This is a bucket of a few different problems. The Support position tends to earn less XP and less gold than other positions. Support players can have a lot of down time without interesting things to do. Statistically, Support players have less of an impact on the outcome of the game than other lanes (especially Jungler and ADC).

> 2) More recognition for Support players. The game does a terrible job of letting you know if that Support you had was really MVP. We celebrate things like KDA, but not at how great your Support was at blocking or engaging (and no, I don’t think number of wards placed is the stat we’re going for).

> 3) More diverse ways to play Support. This gets into non-traditional champions in the Support role and also includes experiments like making traditional support champions less expensive so players can try out more of them to find one they like.

> 1/5/2017

I mean back when I played Heroes of Newerth I loved playing support because even though it was much the same, when something amazing happened like I body blocked a killshot, or disabled a kill shot or set up an amazing play there were actual announcements for that. 

If someone came in with 100% health and tried to 1 shot my squishy carry and I disabled them then we killed them. A huge announcer would scream (depending on the pack) HUMILIATION.

On other cases it might make the announcement SAVIOR or GET ON MY LEVEL or even the default SHUT DOWN.

These kinds of things go a long way to make supports have more fun and for people to recognize the situation and the supports.
Make more fun styled supports like bard. Or like lucio from overwatch.

The main problem is that people like to be **Powerful** in League, I find that when I'm playing 16/2 darius and I can run around the map and do as I please I'm having the most fun. When I'm playing support I have to rely on my team to know what they're doing, even if I play thresh and throw the enemy adc right in my adcs face, they still have to do the damage while keeping themselves alive. Even if I can feel **powerful** playing thresh because the enemy team knows if I hook them they're dead, it still feels dull having to rely on my team so much, I like every other role because I can **carry**, I have that opportunity by myself. Unless I'm playing with 4 other friends I gotta try and solo carry every game and even when I'm supporting the best to my abilities its just not possible in that role. I have seen some insanely good supports, I was playing a game as Darius and I was super fed, there was a level 7 nami on the enemy team that would bravely run straight at me and constantly harass me spamming her bubble and Ebb and flow on me but unfortunately none of her team would follow up on what she was doing and I would just turn on her and get a free kill. She was doing everything she could do as a support on an insane level, she had both objectives warded 24/7 and we had to keep sweeping dragon every single time, she landed perfects ults that would set our entire team up to be ambushed. But unfortunately the rest of her team was an awkward mess that couldn't initiate properly and they ended up losing because of it. Probably the only time I had ever felt sorry and wanted a support to win. Her team definitely didn't deserve her.

Yeah that's also true. It seems most casual players don't like team reliance much and the data shows it too. The next role in the most shortage after support is ADC, which happens to be the 2nd most team reliant role.

https://am-a.akamaihd.net/image?f=https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/images/articles/2016/may/DQA/graph-primaryposition.png

If Riot can fix that, and still have support feel support-ish somehow, then it would awesome. But it's very hard and risky though, so I don't blame them if they go for more impact and recognition changes instead.

> [{quoted}](name=Tele,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=vkg8amMs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-30T23:19:05.954+0000)
>
> _Autofill isn't the problem, support is the problem._ Autofill is just a temporary solution Riot put in place while they rework support.

There's nothing wrong with the idea of a support role. When you have a map with 3 lanes and 5 players and a certain strategy to have a late game scaling squishy adc, you will always have a support. It's just optimal meta. There will be no rework unless they remove adcs.

The whole situation of support, autofill, flex queue etc can be solved very simply by deleting flex queue in regions where there are bugger all players and just having soloqueue like it used to be. There were no issues with queue times in season 5. Back then all players also knew that they had to know every role to play ranked. Stupid dynamic/flex queue ruins everything on a server with a small population.
They could just give sightstone a unique passive that you get 100% of the exp of minons that die in exp range. No one like building sightsotne anyway other than supports and jungle lee sins.
